The following taxes are levied upon the taxable property of Chester County for the year 1952 for expenditure during the fiscal year commencing July 1, 1952 and ending July 1, 1953, for the following purposes: (a) To provide funds for retiring and paying interest on Chester County Hospital bonds (issue of 1950) and Hospital Water and Sewage bonds (issue of 1950) and War Memorial Building bonds (issue of 1949), three mills; (b) For Chester County Hospital two mills, if so much be necessary; Provided, that out of these funds the Chester County Hospital Board is required and directed to take care of all operations and medical treatment for charity patients: Provided, further, that the amount spent for charity patients shall not exceed eightyfive hundred dollars ($8,500.00).
(c) For county roads five mills to be expended on the county roads, including all those roads heretofore known as Township Roads.

Said expenditures shall include labor, roads, bridges, culverts and pipe lines and the construction program operated in consection with and under the supervision of the State Highway Department on roads now in the State Highway System.

The funds raised from this levy are appropriated for the above stated purposes only, and any new roads, construction or projects shall not be undertaken by the County Manager unless an appropriation has been made therefor by the County Legislative Delegation.
(d) For Chester County Library one and three quarters mills; Provided, this levy shall supersede levy made in Act No.

293 of the acts of the General Assembly of 1949, Provided, however, that the Auditor of Chester County is hereby vested with the authority upon the written approval of a majority of the Chester County Legislative Delegation to reduce these levies or to eliminate them entirely.

Provided, further, that in case the funds provided by the above levies prove to be more than enough for said purposes, then, the Treasurer upon the written authority of the majority of the Chester County Legislative Delegation shall transfer such excess funds to the Chester County Contingent Fund.

Provided, that the funds made available from the levy of taxes in Section 2, sulsection (b) of this act for operations and medical treatment of charity patients are to be expended by the County Manager upon the recommendation of the Public Welfare Board.

Provided, further, that the Public Welfare Board along with the Chester County Hospital Board and the County Manager shall make such rules and regulations as they may deem wise for controlling and disbursing the said funds for the purpose of giving surgical operations, medical treatment and hospitalization as they may deem necessary for the citizens of Chester County deserving free treatment and free operations.

The County Treasurer is empowered to borrow in anticipation of taxes levied, so much money as may be necessary to pay the authorized expenses of the county in case of emergency; Provided, it shall be borrowed upon the request of the Board of County Directors, with the approval in writing of a majority of the Chester County Legislative Delegation.

In the event it should be found that the amount appropriated for any specific purpose is more than is necessary, the County Manager shall have the right, upon the approval of a majority of the Legislative Delegation, to apply such surplus to other necessary county purposes; and provided, further, that the County Manager shall have the right to exceed the appropriation herein made for the specific purposes, but no further than is authorized in writing by a majority of the Legislative Delegation.

All county officers, departments, boards and agencies when in need of supplies, shall make written requisition to the County Manager for all supplies needed and in no case shall any purchases be made except as above specified.

The County Manager is hereby authorized to allow and pay for full ten days time every two weeks for regular truck drivers, regular machine hands, regular machinists or mechanics, regular foreman of bridge gangs and regular patrol foremen when their time may be interfered with by weather conditions; Provided, these employees shall be paid weekly; Provided, however, that these emplovees report for work and do such work as conditions will permit; Provided, further, that this shall not interfere with previous arrangements made by the County Manager in case of sickness of employees and shall not interfere with the number of holidays heretofore allowed; and provided, further, that the provisions of this section shafl not be construed to interfere with the authority of the County Manager to discharge any employee for cause, dismiss one when his term of employment has expired or ay off one when his services are not needed or when there are no funds with which to pay for the work in which he is engaged.

Provided, further, that the County Manager is hereby authorized to allow a vacation of one week each year with pay for such employees who have been in the employ of the county for one full continuous vear immediately preceding such vacation.

Provided, further, that the rate of pay for all county road employees shall be determined and fixed by the County Manager and shall be consistent with the amount appropriated each year in the annual Chester County Supply Act.
Provided, further, that when the pay is so determined by the County Manager, said rates of pay shall be recommended to the County Board of Directors for their approval.

All appropriations made in this act shall be divided as nearly as possible into twelve equal monthly installments by the County Manager and in no case shall the amount expended in any one month be greater than onetwelfth of the total.

Provided, however, that the amount expended in any one month by the County Manager may be increased if the appropriation made proves to be insufficient ; Provided, further, that any increase in any monthly appropriation shall be first approved by a majority of the Chester County Legislative Delegation.
The furniture, fixtures, and equipment located on the second floor of the Chester County War Memorial Building shall not be loaned or removed from said building.

The County Manager is hereby authorized and empowered, if in his judgment he finds it to be for the best interest of Chester County to lease land and building known as the Chester County Nursing and Convalescent Home, to an individual for such consideration as he may determine.
The lease shall contain a stipulation that the property so leased shall be used by the lessee solely as a private home for the care of the aged and indigent citizens of Chester County.
The lease shall be executed in the name of Chester County and signed by the County Manager.
Provided, that before any lease is made by the County Manager he shall submit same to the County Board of Directors for their approval.

The salaries appropriated in this act for all county officers and offices are appropriated in lieu of all fees now proVided by law and shall be paid in lieu of all fees; Provided, however, the Delinquent Tax Collector shall be entitled to retain mileage charged in the collection of delinquent taxes as now provided by law.
The salary of the court bailiff is hereby fixed at six dollars per diem for days actually served in court.

The County Manager is hereby authorized and directed to post on or before the tenth day of each month, on the bulletin board in the courthouse, an itemized list of all disbursements made during the preceding month.
The County Manager is hereby authorized and directed to maintain all streets in the City of Chester not now in the State Highway System.
All acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are hereare hereby repealed.
951 An Act To Amend Act No.
496 Of The Acts And Joint Resolutions Of The General Assembly, 1951, The Same Being The Chester County Supply Act, So As To Designate The Location Of Certain County Offices.
Act 496 of 1951 amendedlocation of certain offices and living quarters of jailor, Chester County.Section 20 of Act No.
496 of the Acts and Joint Resolutions of the General Assembly, 1951, is amended by striking out the section and inserting in lieu thereof the following : section 20.
The sheriffs office shall be located in the courthouse in the office now occupied by the delinquent tax collector.
The office of the rural police shall be located in the courthouse in the office opposite the magistrates office.

The jailor shall occupy living quarters in the Chester County jail and the delinquent tax collector shall share the office now occupied by the forest ranger. Section 2. Repeal.All acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are hereby repealed.
952 An Act Authorizing The Great Falls Public Service Commission To Borrow Money, And To Pledge Anticipated Tax Collections As Security Therefor.

Great Falls Public Service Commission borrow.T he Great Falls Public Service Commission is hereby authorized, from time to time to borrow such funds as are necessary for the carrying out of the functions imposed upon it by the Act of the Legislature approved the eighteenth day of June 1949, entitled An Act To Create The Great Falls Public Service District and any and all acts amendatory thereof, and as security for any loan made under authority hereof may pledge the anticipated tax collections for the then current year, provided, the sum total of any sums so borrowed in any year shall not exceed fifty per cent of the anticipated tax revenues, Section 2.

Execution, maturity and payment of obligations.Any note given under the authority of this act for any sums so borrowed shall be signed by the chairman and the secretary of the commission in the name of the district, with the seal of the commission impressed thereon, and shall mature not later than January fifteenth of the succeeding year, and a copy thereof shall be immediately filed with the County Treasurer of Chester County, who shall note the same as a charge against the anticipated tax collections, and the county treasurer, upon presentation at or after maturity shall pay the same out of any funds of the district then in his hands, other than funds set aside for payment of the bonds heretofore or hereafter issued by the district, with interest.

No interest, other than interest up until the date of the maturity of any note of the district, shall be paid upon any note of the district unless the same be presented to the county treasurer at maturity, and payment refused, nor, after such refusal, unless the holder shall thereafter with due diligence, present said note or notes for payment.
Time effectiveThis act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 4th day of April, 1952.
953 An Act To Provide Supplemental Appropriations For Chesterfield County For The Fiscal Year 195152 And To Provide For The Expenditure Thereof.

Whereas, the livestock industry is of great and rapidly increasing importance to the economy of Chesterfield County; and, Whereas, the services of the present assistant county agent have been of great value to the farmers of Chesterfield County ; and, Whereas, the appropriation for the Clemson Extension Service for 19511952 was insufficient to give the assistant county agents salary increases comparable to those given most state employees; and, Whereas, many farmers of Chesterfield County are afraid that they will lose the services of their present assistant county agent and have, therefore, petitioned the legislative delegation that he be given a salary supplement for the remainder of the current fiscal year; and Whereas, the appropriation for hospitalization for indigent people of Chesterfield County is exhausted; and Whereas, it is estimated that approximately five thousand dollars ($5,000.00) will be required to pay for the indispensable hospitalization services for the indigent until the end of the current fiscal year ; and Whereas, since the last general election many citizens of Chesterfield County have arrived at voting age; and Whereas, the population of the county has been increased considerably by workers attracted by the various opportunities offered by industry ; and Whereas, it is considered highly desirable, in furtherance of our democratic principles, that such persons as are not now registered be given an opportunity to register in time to vote in the next election.

Appropriation supplement salary of assistant county agent, Chesterfield County.There is hereby appropriated from the unappropriated funds of Chesterfield County the sum of three hundred dollars ($300.00), the sum to be paid as a salary supplement to the assistant county agent for Chesterfield County at the rate of fifty dollars per month for the months of January through June, 1952; such appropriation being made for the purpose of insuring the continued services of a livestock and pasture specialist for Chesterfield County.

Appropriation for hospitalization of destitute citizens.There is hereby appropriated from the unappropriated funds of Chesterfield County the sum of five thousand dollars ($5,000.00), if so much be necessary, to be expended ,as now provided by law, in payment of hospital expenses of destitute citizens of Chesterfield County.

Appropriation for board of registration.There is hereby appropriated from the general funds of Chesterfield County the sum of one thousand dollars ($1,000.00), or so much thereof as may be necessary, which is to be expended by the Chesterfield County Board of Registration for the following purposes: $300.00 for advertising, printing and supplies.
$300.00 for secretarial help, to be employed by majority of members of the Board of Registration.
$400.00 for travel, travel expenses to be paid at the rate of 7 per mile and to be itemized.
All disbursements under this appropriation shall be made on vouchers drawn by the Chesterfield County Board of Registration.
Supplementary.The aforesaid appropriations are supplementary to all other appropriations heretofore made and now in effect for the fiscal year 19511952.
Time effective.This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 4th day of April, 1952.

954 A Joint Resolution To Provide For A Referendum In The Primary Election In Chesterfield County In 1952 On The Question As To Whether The Office Of Tax Collector In Chesterfield County Shall Be Abolished And The Delinquent Taxes Collected By The Sheriff And His Deputies.

Whereas, there is a division of opinion among the qualified electors of Chesterfield County as to whether the office of tax collector should be abolished and the delinquent taxes collected by the sheriff and his deputies ; and, Whereas, the Chesterfield County Legislative Delegation desires to ascertain the opinion of the electors of Chesterfield County upon the question.

Now, Therefore, Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of South Carolina: Section 1. Referendum on abolishment of office of tax collector and collection of delinquent taxes by sheriff, Chesterfield County.

That the question of whether the office of tax collector in Chesterfield County shall be abolished and the delinquent taxes be collected by the sheriff and his deputies shall be submitted to the voters of Chesterfield County in the 1952 primary election.

Delivery of ballots to political parties The county commissioners of Chesterfield County are directed and required to have prepared and printed a sufficient number of ballots in the form prescribed in Section 7 of this act and deliver the ballots to the chairman of the executive committee of each political party which shall conduct a primary election in 1952, five days before the time of the primary election or elections.

Delivery of ballots to precinctsThe chairman of every political party which shall conduct a primary election in Chesterfield County in 1952 shall deliver to the managers of election at each voting precinct in Chesterfield County a sufficient number of the ballots to permit all voters entitled to vote in the primary election at each poll to vote on the question.
Deliver of ballots to votersThe managers of election in the primary election or elections shall deliver to each voter one of the ballots.

Canvass of ballots and return of results.The ballots cast on the question shall be counted by the managers and the results thereof returned to the county chairman in the same manner that the regular primary election ballots are canvassed and returned.

Certification of result.The executive committee of each political party which shall conduct a primary election in Chesterfield County in 1952 shall tabulate the returns on the referendum question and certify the results thereof to the Senator and Members of the House of Representatives from Chesterfield County.

Form and voting of ballot.The form of the ballot shall be as follows: Do you favor the abolition of the office of tax collector in Chesterfield County and the collection of the delinquent taxes therein by the sheriff and his deputies, with the employment of such additional personnel in the sheriff's office as may be necessary?

YES J NO 0 Voters in favor of abolishing the office of tax collector and for the delinquent taxes to be collected by the sheriff and his deputies will place a check or cross mark in the box opposite the word YES. Voters opposed to abolishing the office of tax collector and the collection of delinquent taxes by the sheriff and his deputies will place a check or cross mark in the box opposite the word NO. Section 8. Repeal.aAll acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are hereby repealed.
Time effective This resolution shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 6th day of March, 1952.

955 A Joint Resolution To Provide For A Referendum In The Primary Election In Chesterfield County In The Year 1952 On The Question As To Whether Or Not The County Shall Issue Bonds In An Amount Not To Exceed Two Hundred Thousand Dollars ($200,000.00) For The Purpose Of Constructing A County Hospital.

Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of South Carolina: Section 1. Referendum on issuance of bonds for hospital, Chesterfield County.The question of whether or not the county shall issue bonds not to exceed two hundred thousand dollars ($200,000.00) for the purpose of constructing a county hospital shall be submitted to the voters of Chesterfield County in the 1952 primary election.

Delivery of ballots to political partiesThe county commissioners of Chesterfield County are directed to have prepared and printed a sufficient number of ballots in the form prescribed in Section 7 and delivered to the chairman of the executive committee of each political party which conducts a primary election in 1952, five days before the time of the primary election or elections.

Delivery of ballots to precinctsThe chairman of every political party which conducts a primary election in Chesterfield County in 1952 shall deliver to the manager of the election at each voting precinct a sufficient number of the ballots to permit all voters entitled to vote in the primary to vote on the question.
Delivery of ballots to voters.The managers of election in the primary election or elections shall deliver to each voter one of the ballots.

Canvass of ballots and return of results.The ballots cast on the question shall be counted by the managers and the results returned to the committee chairman in the same manner that the regular primary election ballots are canvassed and returned.

Certification of result.vThe executive committee of each political party which conducts the primary elections in Chesterfield County in 1952 shall tabulate the returns on the referendum question and certify the results to the Senator and Members of the House of Representatives of Chesterfield County.

Form and voting of ballot.The form of the ballot shall be as follows: Do you favor the county issuing bonds not to exceed two hundred thousand dollars ($200,000.00) to finance thirtyfive per cent of the cost of a county hospital, provided sixtyfive per cent of the cost shall be available from federal funds, and also a tenmill countywide levy for the purpose of paying off the bonded indebtedness and maintaining the hospital ?

Yes (J No [] Voters in favor of issuing the bonds shall deposit a ballot with a check or cross mark in the square after the word Yes, and voters opposed to issuing the bonds shall deposit a ballot with a check or cross mark in the square after the word No. Section 8. Repeal.All acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are hereby repealed.
Time effective.This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 4th day of April, 1952.

956 A Joint Resolution Providing For Presenting The Question Of Consolidation Of School Districts Of Chesterfield County To The Voters Of That County At A Special General Election To Be Held On The Second Tuesday In April, 1952.

Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of South Carolina: Section 1. Referendum on consolidation of school districts, Chesterfield County.The question of whether Chesterfield County shall be consolidated into one school district or whether the county shall be divided into more than one such district shall be submitted to the voters of the county at a special general election to be held on the second Tuesday in April, 1952.

Duties of board of educationvThe Board of Education of Chesterfield County is directed to have prepared and printed a sufficient number of ballots in the form prescribed by this act and to have charge of advertising, holding, and declaring the results of the special general election.
Payment of expenses.The expenses incident to the holding of the election provided for by this act shall be paid from the general fund of Chesterfield County.

NoticeAt least ten days prior to the election, the Board of Education of Chesterfield County shall advertise in all newspapers having general circulation in Chesterfield County the fact that at such election the question of consolidating the county into one or several school districts will be presented to the voters.

Form of ballotThe form of the ballots presented to the voters of Chesterfield County shall be as follows: T favor one School District for Chesterfield County ([] T favor more than one School District for Chesterfield County [] Section 6. Repeal.all acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are hereby repealed.
Time effective.This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the Ist day of March, 1952
957 An Act To Provide For The Nomination Of A Member Of The County Board Of Education Of Chesterfield County In A Special General Election.
Whereas, the General Assembly of South Carolina by Act No.

379 of the Acts of 1951, conferred upon and vested in the County Board of Education of Chesterfield County, among other great powers and responsibilities, the power and duty to determine whether the public school districts of Chesterfield County should be consolidated into and operated as a county unit system, or whether the school districts therein should be consolidated into two or more public school .

districts ; and, Whereas, it is necessary that this important question be decided by the county board of education; and, Whereas, the present membership of the county board of education is equally divided upon the question as to whether the school districts of Chesterfield County shall be consolidated into a county unit system or whether the school districts therein should be consolidated into two or more public school districts ; and, Whereas, there is presently a vacancy on the county board of education and the county legislative delegation has been unable to agree upon an appointment to fill such vacancy ; and, Whereas, an act has been passed calling for a special general election to be held in Chesterfield County on the second Tuesday in April 1952, for the people of Chesterfield County to express their preference as to whether the school districts of Chesterfield County shall be consolidated into one or two or more public school districts ; and, Whereas, the people of Chesterfield County desire that the existing vacancy on the county board of education be filled; Now, Therefore, Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of South Carolina: Section 1.

Nomination of member of Chesterfield County Board of Education.A member of the county board of education to fill the present vacancy thereon for the remainder of the unexpired term shall be nominated in a special general election to be held in Chesterfield County on the second Tuesday in April, 1952.

Duties of board.The Board of Education of Chesterfield County is hereby directed and required to have prepared and printed a sufficient number of ballots for the nomination of a member of the County Board of Education of Chesterfield County ; to appoint the managers for the special general election; to distribute the ballots and ballot boxes; to advertise the special general election, and to supervise and manage the holding thereof, and to canvass the returns and declare the result thereof.

Provisions applicable to electionThe special general election shall be conducted insofar as practicable, in accordance with the applicable provisions of the state election laws, and if necessary, the county board of education is hereby authorized and empowered to make such rules and regulations as it shall deem necessary to provide for the holding of the special general election.

Candidates.Any person desiring to be a candidate for the office shall file with the county board of education on or before April 1, 1952, a written statement that he or she is a candidate for nomination for the office in the special general election.

Notice of election.Prior to April 12, 1952, the county board of education shall cause a notice of the election to be published, at least one time, in all of the newspapers published in Chesterfield County.
Expenses.The expenses of the special general election shall be paid out of the general fund of Chesterfield County, upon warrants of the county board of education.
Time effective.This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 12th day of March, 1952,

Expenditure from Item (k), Charity Hospitalization appropriations shall be made by the county treasurer upon orders of warrants, in such forms as may be prescribed by him, issued and signed in behalf of the county board of public welfare, for charity hospitalization and contributions toward the funeral expenses of such needy residents of the county whose financial circumstances and the ability of whose relatives to pay the same have been fully investigated and determined by the board of public welfare; and the appropriation shall be budgeted by the board to cover the entire fiscal year and no other funds for said or other charity purposes shall be expended or obligated by any other county board or official, unless approved by the delegation.

All appropriations herein made are subject to the right and authority of the Clarendon County Delegation to change, alter, increase or deduct therefrom at any time without notice, when in its judgment such change, alteration, increase or deduction is necessary for the best interest of the county or to conform with the revenue expected during the life of this act.
This act is intended and is construed to make appropriations for the operation and activities of Clarendon County for the period beginning July 1, 1952 and ending June 30, 1953.
Balances from appropriations in former years, unexpended on August 1, 1953, shall terminate and end as of that date.

The supervisor and treasurer are hereby authorized to borrow money in anticipation of collection of revenues to be expended under this act, not to exceed twenty thousand dollars ($20,000.00) for ordinary county purposes, and also thirty thousand dollars ($30,000.00) additional to pay interest on and principal of county bonds, if it should become necessary; and for any sum or sums so borrowed and interest thereon, not to exceed four (4%) per cent per annum, the officers shall issue the promissory note or notes of the county therefor and as a security for the payment thereof pledge the aforementioned revenues, including 1952 and former years (uncollected) property taxes and/or any and all other county revenues, and the full faith and credit of the county.
. There is hereby appropriated a sufficient amount to build a Nurses Home for the Clarendon Memorial Hospital, said amount to be determined by the Clarendon Delegation.

The County Treasurer of Clarendon County, upon the unanimous written request of the school trustees of any school district in the county, endorsed by the superintendent of education of the county and approved by the majority of the legislative delegation, be, and he is hereby, authorized and empowered, in anticipation of taxes for the year 1952 and also in anticipation of the collection of uncollected taxes for prior years, to borrow for ordinary school purposes in such school district an amount not exceeding eighty (80%) per cent of the amount that will be raised by the tax levy for the year 1952 and the amount due on account of uncollected taxes, at a rate of interest not to exceed four (4%) per cent, and issue the promissory note or other obligation of the county therefor, and as security for the payment of the loan or loans to pledge the taxes to be collected for such school district for the year; Provided, That the proceeds arising from the authority therein given shall be used solely for the payment of ordinary school expenses in keeping schools open in the respective school districts in the county until the schools can realfke from the collection of taxes.

Any note or obligation given for an amount exceeding the total authorization herein shall be and void unless authorized in writing by a majority of the Clarendon County Delegation in the General Assembly.
Any violation of the provisions herein is hereby declared a malfeasance in office and such officer shall be subject to removal by the Governor upon the recommendation of a majority of the delegation.

He shall be liable on his official bond for all such expended or contracted to he spent in excess of the appropriation without first getting the written consent of a majority of the delegation as hereinabove provided.

All purchases of property or supplies of any kind ordinarily purchased within the county, for the use of the county of the value of one hundred dollars ($100.00), or more, shall be made only after ten days notice inviting bids, the notice being posted on the bulletin board in front of the courthouse door, and all bids, received pursuant to such notice, shall be considered and acted upon by the board of county commissioners in open meeting.
All printing, postage and stationery shall be first approved by the county board of commissioners before purchases or obligations are made.

The county treasurer is hereby charged with the additional duty of keeping a record of all disbursements in accordance with the classification and items of the appropriations herein made; and the county supervisor shall enter upon each check or warrant drawn by him the name of the fund or appropriation against which it is drawn and by such entry the treasurer shall charge the expenditure upon his records.

The county treasurer shall set up and keep sufficient books and records, in addition to such now kept or required by law, to fully comply with the foregoing section; and he shall refuse payment of any check or warrant in excess of the appropriation against which it is drawn; and not later than the tenth day of each calendar month thereafter he shall prepare a statement of the total amount paid out upon the various appropriations items, except salaries and other fixed lump sum appropriations, copics of which statement he shall deliver or mail to the supervisor, each member of the county board of commissioners and to each member of the county legislative delegation, and such statement shall include a statement of the cash balance of ordinary county funds in hand.

In the event that any appropriation item is exhausted before the end of the fiscal year covered by this act, and in the opinion of the county board or county legislative delegation, additional funds are necessary for such purposes, the necessity and the grounds therefor may be presented to the county legislative delegation and a majority of the members thereof may authorize additional expenditures, and the written direction of such majority will authorize the county treasurer to pay such excess amounts out of any available funds in his hand.

Whenever it appears to the county board that a purchaser at a tax sale received nothing for his bid, because of double entries or other errors in the county records, they may refund the amount paid on account of such bids by approving a claim therefor against the county which may be paid from collections from forfeited lands or from the appropriation herein for contingent expenses, but nothing herein shall be construed as a warrant or representation by the county of the validity of any title acquired at tax sale now or hereafter.

An audit of the office and records of any part thereof of the county may be had at any time in the fiscal year 19521953 by the county legislative delegation or a majority thereof, and the expenses therefor paid on their written order to the supervisor and treasurer from any available funds in the hands of the latter.

The auditor and treasurer of the county shall so complete the necessary work in their respective offices in order to open the treasurers books for the collection of the 1952 state and county taxes on September 1, 1952, and the collection of the taxes shall begin on that date.

No person, firm or corporation (except recipients from charity appropriation and except witnesses and jurors paid by the county) shall be paid any monies herein appropriated unless he or it shall first pay in full any and all outstanding tax executions against him or it or his or its property; Provided, That such tax executions may be in monthly installments satisfactory to the tax collector.

The auditor shall levy for the year 1952 and ensuing years and the treasurer shall collect as other property taxes a sufficient millage upon all of the taxable property of the county to meet the principal and interest payments upon all county bonds of whatever issue as they mature and to create a sufficient sinking fund for the lump maturity of the bonds, this sinking fund may be deposited and invested as now provided by law; and there shall henceforth be only this one tax levy for the purposes and the proceeds thereof shall be combined by the treasurer with any funds now or liereafter in hand applicable thereto and such fund shall be the County Bond Fund from which only county bond, principal and interest payments shall be made.
Any of the persons or agencies drawing travel allowances, as herein provided, shall show by affidavit to be filed with the county board of commissioners each month that such gasoline and.
oil was actually used on county business.

The Town of Manning may use the County Jail for the confinement of their prisoners but shall be required to pay to the county the sum of one dollar per prisoner per day; which sum shall be remitted to the County Board of Commissioners monthly by the Town of Manning, together with the statement of the jailor of the names of the prisoners and the days each was confined.
This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 4th day of March, 1952.
959 An Act To Authorize And Empower The Clarendon County Board Of Commissioners To Construct A New Jail Or Renovate The Present Jail And To Provide An Appropriation Therefor.

Construct new jail or renovate present jail, Clarendon County.The Clarendon County Board of Commissioners is hereby authorized and empowered to construct a new jail or renovate the present jail, whichever the board deems advisable.

Appropriation.There is hereby appropriated the sum of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00) from the general funds of the county, or so much thereof as may be necessary, for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of this act.
Time effectiveThis act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 14th day of February, 1952

960 An Act To Provide For The Holding Of An Election In Each School District In Clarendon County Upon The Question Of The Issuance Of Bonds Of The Districts In A Sum Not Exceeding The Constitutional Limit For School Purposes; To Provide For The Issuance Of Such Bonds Upon The Approval By The People And To Provide For The Payment Of Same.

School districts may issue bonds if elections thereon favorable, Clarendon Countyuse of proceeds.lIf the elections provided for herein shall result favorably, the respective Boards of Trustees of the School Districts and the Treasurer of Clarendon County are authorized and empowered to issue and sell serial coupon bonds of the school districts in a sum not exceeding the constitutional limit.

The proceeds of the bonds shall be used for constructing and equipping school buildings and facilities used in connection with schools, including the purchase of sites for such buildings or facilities.
The bonds shall be in such denominations, and shall bear such interest, not exceeding four per cent per annum, as the respective boards of trustees and the treasurer may prescribe.
They shall be payable at the office of the Clarendon County Treasurer from time to time over a period not exceeding twenty years.
The bonds may be redeemed on call after ten years from the date of same.

The bonds shall be sold at public sale after an advertisement for bids shall have been published in a paper of general circulation within the County at least twice fifteen days prior to the date of the opening of bids.
Execution.The bonds shall be signed by the treasurer and the Boards of Trustees of the respective School Districts in Clarendon County.

The coupons attached to the bonds need only be signed by the County Treasurer and the chairman of the boards of trustees, and their lithographed or engraved signatures thereon shall be a sufficient signing of same.
Exempt from taxes.The bonds shall be exempt from the payment of all county, state, school and municipal taxes.

Payment.The full faith, credit, and taxing power of the school districts are hereby irrevocably pledged for the payment of the bonds and all interest thereon, and the Auditor of Clarendon County shall levy an annual tax upon all the taxable property in the respective school districts sufficient to pay the bonds and interest as they may mature, and the treasurer of the county shall collect the taxes so levied as other taxes are collected.

Election on issuance.Before, however, any bonds are issued pursuant to the authority herein conferred, the Boards of Trustees of each School District are hereby empowered and directed to order an election to be held in the school district, on the question of the issuance of bonds of the school district in an amount not exceeding the constitutional limit.

Notice of the holding of such elections shall be given by publication in a newspaper, published in and having general circulation in Clarendon County, at least twice not less than ten days prior to the time fixed for each election.
The notice shall state the purpose of election and the time and place fixed for the holding of the election.
The Boards of Trustees shall designate the managers of the elections.
The qualified electors residing in each School District shall be allowed to vote.
The polls shall open at eight oclock in the forenoon and shall remain continuously open until four oclock in the afternoon, when they shall be closed.

The managers shall make return to the boards of trustees which shall canvas the returns and declare the results of the election by a resolution duly adopted by it and entered upon the minutes of its proceedings.

The result of the election as declared by the boards of trustees shall not be open to question except by a suit or proceeding instituted within thirty days from the date of the declaration of the result of the election.
The boards of trustees shall provide suitable ballots to be used in the conduct of each election and shall be in form substantially as follows: Shall the Board of Trustees of School District No.
ee ee of Clarendon County, be empowered to issue bonds of the district in an amount not exceeding .thousand dollars ($ . )
whose proceeds shall be used for school purposes in the district?

In favor of the issuance of such bonds O Opposed te the issuance of such bonds O hose voting in favor of the issuance of such bonds shall deposit a ballot with a check or cross mark in the square after the words In favor of the issuance of such bends; those voting against the issuance of such bonds shall deposit a ballot with a check or cross mark in the eae square after the words Opposed to the issuance of such bond Ss.
If a majority of the voters voting in the election vote in favor of the issuance of bonds, the bonds shall be issued as authorized and directed in this act, otherwise they shall not be issued.
Time effective This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 28th day of February, 1952.
961 An Act To Provide For The Issuance Of Bonds Of School District No.
1 In Clarendon County In A Sum Not Exceeding The Constitutional Limit For School Purposes And To Provide For The Payment Of Same.
1 issue bonds for school purposes, Clarendon County.The Board of Trustees of School District No.
1 and the Treasurer of Clarendon County are authorized and empowered to issue and sell serial coupon bonds of the school district ina sum not exceeding the constitutional limit.

The proceeds of the bonds shall be used for constructing and equipping school buildings and facilities used in connection with schools, including the purchase of sites fur such buildings or facilities.
The bonds shall be in such denominations, and shall bear such interest, not exceeding four per cent per annum, as the board of trustees and the treasurer may prescribe.

The bonds shall be sold at public sale after an advertisement for bids shall have been published in a paper of general circulation within the county at least twice fifteen days prior to the date of the opening of bids.
Execution.The bonds shall be signed by the treasurer and the Board of Trustees of School District No.
1 in Clarendon County.

The coupons attached to the bonds need only be signed by the county treasurer and the chairman of the board of trustees, and their lithographed or engraved signatures thereon shall be a sufficient signing of same.

Payment.The full faith, credit, and taxing power of the school district are hereby irrevocably pledged for the payment of the bonds and all interest thereon, and the Auditor of Clarendon County shall levy an annual tax upon all the taxable property in the school district sufficient to pay the bonds and interest as they may mature, and the treasurer of the county shall collect the taxes so levied as other taxes are collected.
Time effectiveThis act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the Ist day of March, 1952.

The county treasurer, after applying all current cash revenues, is hereby authorized and empowered to pay from the special reserve or surplus fund any items of the appropriations made in Section 1 hereof which may be expended before the collection of taxes for the year 1952, and before other current revenues shall accrue in sufficient amount to pay said appropriations, but the county treasurer, when taxes are collected and current revenues are received sufficient for said purposes, shall reimburse the special reserve or surplus fund for any monies expended therefrom for the purpose of paying said appropriations.
Direct appropriations having been made.

for the running expenses, debt service for bonds and all other expenditures in connection with the school system of the county, rural library work and the county board fund, as appear in Section 1, Item 14, all tax levies imposed by General Statutes, by the County Rural Library Act, and by Act No.
388 of the Acts of the General Assembly of 1944 are hereby suspended for the tax year 1952 and such expenditures will be paid from the direct appropriations hereinabove made.
The county auditor shall determine the amount of tax levy necessaty to pay the appropriations hereinabove made and shall use same in preparing the tax books for Colleton County.

If any of the items, or portions thereof, for which funds are herein apropriated should be assumed by the state and appropriations therefor be made by the state, or if the same shall become available in any other manner, then the amounts for such purposes herein appropriated shall be paid to the special reserve fund in the amount herein appropriated if the state appropriations or other available funds be sufficient for that amount, and, if the state appropriations or other available funds should not be sufficient, then only so much of the funds herein appropriated as may be necessary shall be used with the balance to be paid to the special reserve fund.

The county supervisor is authorized and directed to call to his assistance in maintaining the courthouse and other public grounds the Campbell Ashley Garden Club, and to furnish plants, fertilizer and labor for the beautification of the grounds.

From the County Board of Education Fund all members of the County Board of Education except the Superintendent of Education shall be paid ten dollars per day for each day in attendance upon meetings of the county board and mileage from the homes of the members each way at the rate of seven cents per mile.

The schools of Colleton County being operated on a county unit system, the County Board of Education is hereby authorized to make application for and fteceive in behalf of all the schools of the county such building funds as may be available under the terms of the State Appropriation Act for the fiscal year 19511952 and all subsequent aid to school house construction, which power shall be exercised by the county board after consultation with various district boards of trustees wherever any conflict might arise.

The County Board of Education is authorized to establish and operate schools in such locations as will best serve the educational needs of the county and to pay the countys portion of the expense of operating such schools from the general school funds of the county, but the county board shall have no power to move the general location of schools now operating as high schools so long as such high schools may meet enrollment and average attendance requirements as now provided by law.
The county board in its discretion may establish a new high school or high schools wherever the same will best serve the educational interests of the county.

The County Board of Education shall establish for approval by the State Educational Finance Commission bus routes for transporting school children now being operated or which may hereafter be established.
963 An Act To Establish The Procedure For The Sale Of Surplus School Properties In Colleton County.

Board of education may declare unneeded school property surplus, Colleton County.The County Board of Education for Colleton County is hereby authorized and directed to consult with the boards of school trustees in the county and to investigate the need of retaining school buildings not now in use and the lands upon which they are located.

If after full investigation the county board of education should determine that the buildings are no longer needed for the schools of Colleton County it shall declare the same to be surplus and certify the same to the county superintendent of education for disposition.

sellUpon receipt of such declaration of surplus the county superintendent of education shall advertise for sale said school houses and land upon which they are located in a newspaper published in Colleton County by two successive publications, and shall receive sealed bids therefor not later than thirty days nor less than fifteen days from the first advertisement.

The county superintendent shall have the right to reject any and all bids, but if any of the bids appear satisfactory to the county superintendent he may accept the highest satisfactory bid and declare the property sold.

Conveyances.Upon the successful bidder complying with the terms of his bid the county superintendent of education shall issue deed conveying the interest of the county in the said property and thereafter the purchaser may take possession of the property.

Use of receipts.All moneys paid to the county superintendent of education for the purchase of school properties shall be paid over by the county superintendent of education to the county treasurer who shall place said funds in the sinking funds for the payment of school bonds in Colleton County issued prior to January 1, 1952.
Repeal.aAll acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are repealed.
Time effectiveThis act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 3rd day of March, 1952,
964 An Act To Amend Act No.
469 Of The Acts Of 1949 General Assembly As Amended By Acts Nos. 1169 And 1170 Of The Acts Of 1950 General Assembly And Act No.
501 Of The Acts Of 1951 General Assembly 8o As To Provide For The Increased Cost Of The Colleton County Hospital And Nurses Home.
Act 469 of 1949 amendedmaximum cost of hospital and nurses home, Colleton County.That Section 1 of Act No.

469 of the Acts of the General Assembly for the year 1949 entitled An Act To Authorize The County Of Colleton To Issue And Sell Bonds Of Said County For The Purpose Of Constructing A Hospital And Nurses Home And Furnishing Same And To Provide For The Payment Thereof as amended by Acts Nos. 1169 and 1170 of the Acts of the General Asembly for the year 1950,and by Act No.

501 of the Acts of the General Assembly for the year 1951, be and the same hereby is amended by striking out the words and figures Tight Hundred Fifty Thousand Six Hundred Sixtyeight and 00/100 ($850,668.00) Dollars and inserting in lieu thereof the words and figures one million, one hundred thousand dollars ($1,100,000.00), so that Section 1 so amended shall read as follows: section 1.

The County of Colleton is hereby authorized to issue and sell general obligation negotiable coupon bonds of the County of Colleton in the amount of not exceeding three hundred thousand and 00/100 dollars ($300,000.00) for the purpose of constructing a county hospital and a nurses home and furnishing and equipping the same, the total cost not to exceed one million, one hundred thousand dollars ($1,100,000.00) project cost and not exceeding two thousand and 00/100 dollars ($2,000.00) nonproject cost.

Funds now in the county treasury derived from a special levy of five mills on the taxable property of Colleton County for debt service on hospital bonds and collected for the tax years 1949, 1950 and 1951 shall he avplied to the cost of the hospital and nurses home and the hornd issue reduced accordingly.

The County Treasurer is hereby authorized to make available from the county reserve fund upon certification of the county hospital board the nonproject cost not exceeding two thousand and 00100 dollars ($2,000.00) when the same shall be needed. Section 2. Repeal.All acts or parts of acts inconsistent with the provisions of this act are hereby repealed.
Time effectiveThis act shall take effect upon the approval by the Governor. Approved the 29th day of February, 1952.

The Board of Directors to the county manager is hereby empowered to borrow money for current expenses and road maintenance in anticipation of taxes to be collected and the county manager shall not pay any claims in excess of the appropriation made for such purposes unless consent thereto is given hy the Senator and a majority of the members of the delegation.

All county officers with exception of the superintendent of education shall furnish the county manager a written request for all supplies and equipment needed, and no obligation created by any county official except the county manager, with the approval of the board of directors, shall be valid against the county.
I.xamination in lunacy cases shall be made by two physicians and the fee for this examination shall not exceed five dollars for each examining physician.
The attaches and bailiffs for the Common Pleas and General Sessions Court of Darlington County shall be appointed by the clerk of court and all checks for witnesses.
jurors and others in attendance upon the courts shall be signed by the Clerk of Court of Darlington County.
The sheriff's deputies shall be appointed by the sheriff and shall serve at the pleasure of the sheriff.

The sheriff and each of his deputies shall be furnished with a telephone in his home: Provided, the county shall not pay for any long distance calls charged thereto, except for county business purposes; Provided, further, the sheriff may designate one of his deputies as chief deputy.

The sheriff shall appoint a jailor whose term of office shall be for one year on a fiscal year basis beginning July 1, 1952 Provided, however, that he may be removed at any time at the sheriff's pleasure.
The jailor, subject to the supervision of the sheriff, shall be responsible for the dieting of prisoners.
There shall be employed annually, about July, a competent auditor, to be appointed by a majority of the delegation, to audit the books of the county.
The work to be done under the supervision of the delegation and the cost to he determined by the delegation and paid out of the contingent fund.

If at any time during the fiscal year it shall appear that there will be a shortage in revenue to pay the amount herein appropriated, the delegation is hereby authorized and directed to reduce such appropriations as the delegation deems advisable in such amount or amounts as to bring expenditures for the fiscal year within the anticipated revenue ; Provided, that in the event and at any time during the fiscal year it shall appear that the taxes collected from indirect sources, such as from the State of South Carolina, and any other source, be more than sufficient to pay the appropriation herein made, such surplus funds at any time may be transferred from one fund to another upon the written authorization directed to the county treasurer and signed by a majority of the legislative delegation ; Provided, further, that any surplus funds now on hand in any department of Darlington County mav he, after the passage of this act and any time during the fiscal year, transferred to another department or into the general funds, upon authorization by a majority of the members of the legislative delegation.
The amount provided in Item 15, subitem (s), shall not be expended except on approval of the Circuit Judge of the Fourth Judicial Circuit.

The amounts herein appropriated to salaries and oneroads and bridges shall be paid out as near as practicable item twelith each month during the fiscal year 19521953, and if any shall of salary has heen overpaid for any month, such overpayment he deducted from the following month.

Any note or contract made by anv officer of the county or by the county manager for any amount not included in this supply act shall be and void; any officer or emplovee who disregards any of the provisions hereof, without the consent of a majority of the Darlington County Legislative Delegation.
kept on file in the county manager's office, shall be guilty of a mvlfeasance in office and subject to removal.

they are required to send to the State Penitentiary a sufficient number of long term chaingang prisoners and reduce eauinment and other expenses so that the expense will come within the monthly allotment herein provided.

966 An Act To Appropriate A Sum Of Money For Educational Purposes In Darlington County For The Fiscal Year 195253; To Provide For The Expenditure Thereof; And To Provide For The Levy Of A Tax Sufficient To Pay The Sum Appropriated Herein.

Appropriation for educational purposes, Darlington County.The sum of fifteen thousand nine hundred dollars ($15,900.00) is hereby appropriated for educational purposes for Darlington County for the fiscal year 195253.
The sum shall be expended for the following purposes : Item 1.
Travel Expenses, County Superintendent of Education $ 1,000.00 Item 2.

School budgetsThe Board of Trustees of Darlington County School District shall, before July 1, 1952, file with the county board of education a proposed budget for each school in the county for the 195253 fiscal year.
The budget shall itemize proposed expenditures and propose the necessary current levy to cover these expenditures.
The county board shall examine all budgets and its approval shall constitute the authority and direction to the county auditor to levy the tax provided for in Section 1.

Supplementary.This act is supplementary to the General Supply Act of Darlington County which might be in effect for the 195253 fiscal year and the permanent school levies for Darlington County, and shall in no respect be considered as a repeal of them or any part thereof.

Expenditure of funds.The funds herein appropriated shall be expended by the county treasurer in the usual way, but upon request of the superintendent of education, or the chairman of the county board of education.

Supplement salaries or expenses of certain employees.The county board of education may supplement salaries or expenses.of the superintendent of education or other office employees out of any funds in their hands that can legally be expended for such purposes.

967 An Act To Authorize The County Manager Of Darlington County To Hold An Election To Determine Whether Bonds Shall Be Issued For The Purpose Of Erecting And Equipping A Hospital In Darlington County; To Provide For The Issuance Of Not Exceeding One Million Dollars ($1,000,000.00) Of General Obligation Bonds Of Darlington County If The Election Results Favorably Thereto; To Provide For The Payment Of The Bonds; And To Provide For A Hospital Commission To Be Charged With The Management And Control Of All Affairs Pertaining To The Hospital, Including The Erecting And Equipping Thereof.

Darlington County issue bonds for hospital if election thereon favorable.If the election provided for in Section 9 of this act has a favorable result, the County Manager of Darlington County may issue and sell not exceeding one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) of general obligation coupon bonds for Darlington County, for the purpose of erecting and equipping a hospital in the county.
Denominations maturities interest execution.

The bonds shall be of any denominations and shall mature at any dates decided on by the hospital commission herein created and shall bear interest not exceeding four per cent, payable semiannually, but none of the bonds shall mature later than twenty years from the date of issue.

The bonds shall be signed by the County Manager and the Treasurer of Darlington County, but the signatures on the coupons attached to the bonds may be lithographed or engraved thereon and this shall be a sufficient signing thereof.

Saledeposit and disbursement of proceeds.The bonds shall be sold at a public auction to the highest bidder after bids therefor have been advertised for not less than two weeks in a newspaper of general circulation in Darlington County.

The proceeds of the sale of the bonds shall be deposited with the Treasurer of Darlington County to the credit of the Darlington County Hospital Fund, and may be drawn out upon warrants signed by the chairman and the secretary of the hospital commission.

Pledge to pay.The bonds, when executed as provided in this act, shall constitute binding obligations of Darlington County, and the full faith, credit, and taxing power of the county are hereby irrevocably pledged for the payment thereof.

Levy taxes to pay.The Auditor of Darlington County shall levy and the county treasurer shall collect annually, upon all taxable property in the county, a tax sufficient to pay the interest on the bonds and to retire them at maturity.

Darlington County Hospital Commissionduties and powersaudit.A commission consisting of five members, to be known as the Darlington County Hospital Commission, shall be appointed by a majority of the county legislative delegation, including the Senator.
No member of the commission shall be a member of the medical profession.

The term of office of the members of the commission shall be four years, except that the terms of the members first appointed shall be determined by lot at their first meeting as follows: One for one year; one for two years; one for three years: and two for four years.
The commission, at its first meeting, shall elect one of its members to serve as chairman and one to serve as secretary.

The commission shall be charged with the erecting and equipping of the hospital for Darlington County and the management of all the affairs pertaining to the hospital, and shall keep a full and correct account of its acts and expenditures, and this record shall be open at all times to the inspection of the public.
Upon the completion of the hospital and its equipment, the commission shall file a statement of all expenditures in the office of the Clerk of Court of Darlington County as a public record thereof.
Within three months after the close of each fiscal vear the commission shall have a complete audit of its affairs made by a certified public accountant.
Copies of the audit shall be filed with the Clerk of Court of Darlington County.
the county manager, and the chairman of the county legislative delegation.

Giftsrules for operating hospitalThe commission shall have authority to accept all donations, or grants of money, personal property, or real estate for the benefit and use of the Darlington County Hospital and to hold or use them according to the terms of the donations or grants.
The commission shall adopt and promulgate rules and regulations for the operation and government of the hospital so as to insure the efficient, economical, and equitable administration thereof.

PatientsThe commission shall require all patients who enter the hospital to pay compensation for hospital care in an amount which the commission considers just, and it shall have the power to acept charity patients who are citizens of Darlington County.
No person shall be designated as a charity patient unless he and his immediate family are entirely without means to pay the cost of his hospital care.

Election on issuance of bonds.Before any bonds shall be issued pursuant to this act there shall be an election held in Darlington County for the purpose of submitting the question of the issue of the bonds to the qualified electors of the county.

The election shall be held upon request of the hospital commission to the county manager, and the county manager shall give three weeks notice of the election and shall cause to be printed a sufficient number of ballots for use in voting upon the question.

The ballots shall have the following words written or printed thereon: Shall the County Manager of Darlington County issue bonds in an amount not exceeding one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) to be general obligation bonds of Darlington County, the proceeds of which shall be used for the erecting and equipping of a hospital in Darlington County ?

In favor of the issue [[] Opposed to the issue [] Those voting in favor of the issue shall place a check or cross mark opposite the words In favor of the issue and those voting against the issue shall place a check or cross mark opposite the words Op> .

posed to the issue If a majority of those voting in the election vote in favor of the issuance of the bonds, the bonds may be issued as provided, but if a majority of those voting vote against the issuance of the bonds, the bonds shall not be issued.
The County Manager of Darlington County shall provide for the election, appoint managers, and do all things necessary for the purpose of carrying out the election.
Time effective This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 27th day of March, 1952.

Supplies such as coal, fuel, office supplies, etc., for the operation of the county courthouse, agricultural building and jail shall be purchased by the board of county commissioners.
No salaries shall be paid in advance.
The Road Supervisor of the County .of Dillon shall perform his duties under the direction and control of the Dillon County Highway Commission.
The Dillon County Highway Commission shall control and maintain strict supervision over all roads and road equipment and all other equipment and installations at the county chaingang camp.
Supplies and equipment for the county chaingang shall be purchased by or at the direction of the Dillon County Highway Commission.
Any and all acts in conflict with this provision are hereby amended to conform therewith.

The county jailor shall be appointed by the board of county commissioners, annually, for a oneyear term beginning as of July first, and shall be subject to removal at any time by a majority vote of the board.
He shall maintain such records as are prescribed by the board or an accountant employed to make the annual Dillon County audit.

. The County Treasurer of Dillon County, and other officers of the county who may handle funds of the county, are hereby authorized and empowered to deposit funds of the county or subdivisions thereof, both current or sinking funds in any bank or banks, but before making such deposits, shall require from such bank or banks a bond equal to or in excess of funds deposited, secured by bonds of the United States Government, or state, county, or any political subdivision thereof, and approved by a majority of the following: chairman of the board of county commissioners, county auditor, county treasurer, chairman of the county board of education, in writing, and filed with the clerk of court for public inspection, to indemnify the county against loss.

Provided, further, that the county treasurer is hereby authorized, in his discretion, to use any sinking fund money on hand to buy any of the bonds or notes of the county or any school district thereof.

. The county auditor is hereby authorized, empowered and directed to charge the following levies against all taxable property of the County of Dillon for the fiscal year 195253 for the following purposes: County ordinary, fourteen mills; Excess teachers salaries, eleven mills ; Incidental expenses for schools, eight mills; Building repairs for schools, six mills; Insurance on public school buildings, two mills; and School lunches, one mill, to be used for lunches upon recommendation of county board of education.
The commutation road tax for the year 195253 shall be two ($2.00) dollars and shall so remain at the same annual rate until changed by the Dillon County Delegation in an annual supply bill.

The amounts appropriated herein, under the several items for the several purposes as indicated, are the maximum amounts appropriated for such purposes, and it shall be unlawful for the various county boards or officers to make contract or contracts, for the expenditure of the monies, or the county treasurer to pay any sums in excess of the amount appropriated, under such item, unless otherwise provided by law, or without the consent in writing, of a majority of the legislative delegation, including the Senator, from Dillon County.

Provided, further, that no funds shall be transferred from one appropriation to another without the consent in writing of a majority of the legislative delegation, including the Senator, from Dillon County.
. The legal office hours for the County of Dillon shall be from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M., except Saturdays when the hours shall be from 8 A.M. to 1 P.M.
Provided, further, that all holidays declared legal holidays by the State of South Carolina are excepted from the provisions thereof.
Provided, further, November 11, December 26, and Thursday, during the week which the South Carolina State Fair is held, are hereby designated as legal holidays in Dillon County.

All funds remaining in treasurers accounts other than appropriated funds shall be set aside as permanent reserve funds and shall be used subject to the same terms and conditions as apply to county sinking funds.

The accountant, making annual audit of the county, shall cause such transfers as are necessary to be made in the event such entries have not been made by the office, or officer, having such funds in his custody.

Before charging off any tax execution as nulla bona, it shall be the duty of the delinquent tax collector to call in session the members of the board of assessors of the district, or districts affected, who shall examine all items proposed to be charged off as uncollectible and no such execution or charge shall be eliminated unless it bears the written approval of the board or the members of the district comprising the board in which the charge was made, and the reason for charging off any nulla bona item shall be written on the face thereof.

The Superintendent of Education of Dillon County is hereby authorized and directed to establish and keep complete records, subject to yearly audit, of all receipts and disbursements of funds of all school hot lunch operations in Dillon County.

All school officials, receiving or disbursing school hot lunch funds, shall submit to the Superintendent of Education of Dillon County monthly reports or statements of their receipts and disbursements of school hot lunch funds.

. Funds which were received by the county treasurer from the state in payment for the school buses owned by the county shall be placed by the county treasurer in a revolving fund to the credit of the County Board of Education of Dillon County.
The board of education is hereby authorized to borrow, without interest, funds from the revolving fund in anticipation of county or state funds to accrue to it.
Any funds so borrowed by the county board of education from the revolving fund shall be repaid upon the receipt by it of any county or state funds pledged in making the loan.

The county auditor is hereby authorized and empowered to raise or lower the levies herein provided as may be necessary to meet the appropriations herein made after taking into consideration the other revenues accruing or to accrue to the county.
Provided, such change in levy is approved in writing by a majority of the legislative delegation, including the Senator, from Dillon County.

It shall be the duty, on or before the fifth day of each month, for all county officers or departments ; namely, board of county commissioners, sheriff, board of education, judge of probate, clerk of court, treasurer, Dillon County Highway Commission, and delinquent tax collector, to make a written report or statement to the county auditor as to the operation of his office or department.
The report or statement shall contain all receipts and disbursements for the previous month.
The county auditor shall compile all reports or statements, monthly, into a general financial statement of the fiscal affairs of Dillon County.
The monthly reports or statements shall be filed in the office of the auditor as public records.
All unexpended appropriated funds in any item of this act shall revert back to the general funds of Dillon County at the end of the fiscal year.

It shall be the duty of the probate judge to make a charge of one ($1.00) dollar for issuance of certified copies of marriage licenses, and one ($1.00) dollar per marriage license application, to a nonresident of Dillon County.
All fees collected under this section shall be paid to the Treasurer of Dillon County and credited to the general funds.
No money shall be spent from the health fund of Dillon County unless a definite health program is set up with the written approval of the legislative delegation, including the Senator.

No pending law suit to which Dillon County is a party may be settled or compromised without the written approval of the entire Dillon County Board of Commissioners and upon the authorization of the entire Dillon County Legislative Delegation.

970 An Act Authorizing The Trustees Of Lakeview Centralized School District No.

1 In Dillon County To Borrow The Sum Of Three Thousand Three Hundred And SeventyFive Dollars ($3, 375.00) For The Purpose Of Purchasing Certain Lands For School Purposes, And To Provide A Tax For The Payment Thereof Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of South Carolina Section 1.
Lakeview Centralized School District No.
1 borrow purchase land, Dillon County.The Board of Trustees of Lakeview Centralized School District No.

1 in Dillon County may borrow the sum of three thousand three hundred and seventyfive dollars ($3,375.00), at such rate or rates of interest and repayable at such time or times as in its discretion is deemed best.

The money so borrowed shall be used to pay for six and three quarters acres of land purchased from Mrs. Ila Mae Temple, to be used for a negro school The loan shall be secured by notes executed by the trustees and countersigned by the Treasurer of Dillon County Section 2. Payment.In order to provide for the payment of the loan, the auditor shall levy and the treasurer shall collect an annual tax upon all the taxable property of the district sufficient to repay the principal and interest in full.

The entire proceeds of the levy shall be paid annually on the principal and interest of the note or notes given to secure the debt until the loan is paid in full with interest, at which time the tax shall no longer be levied.

Deposit and expenditure of proceeds.The amount borrowed shall be deposited with the Treasurer of Dillon County to the credit of the district to be expended upon the order of the board for the purposes provided for in this act.
Time effectiveThis act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 21st day of February, 1952.

Contingent Fund 10,000.00 The above amount is hereby appropriated to meet any unforseen contingencies, which may arise during the year in the operation of the county government.
The same shall be expended upon the written authorization of the Legislative Delegation for Dorchester County, directed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors and Treasurer of the said county.

For Dorchester County Circulating Library 3,600.00 The above amount, together with the amount of money heretofore appropriated for Dorchester County circulating library, to be expended by the county Board of Directors upon the written approval of the Legislative Delegation for Dorchester County.

Bonded Indebtedness: (1) The necessary amount is hereby appropriated to meet the payment of principal and interest maturing during the fiscal year beginning July 1, 1952, and ending June 30, 1953, on all bond issues now outstanding against the County of Dorchester.

(2) The County Treasurer is hereby empowered to borrow during the fiscal year beginning July 1, 1952, and ending June 30, 1953, to the extent of the tax levy and any other income or revenue of the said county, if so much be necessary, upon his note or notes, and is empowered to pledge as security such money borrowed and interest thereon, the taxes of the year 1952 together with any other income or revenue of said county for the year 1953.
(3) That the County Auditor and County Treasurer are hereby required and authorized to collect three dollars ($3.00) per head from all persons liable for road work commutation tax.

(4) All drafts and warrants issued by the County Board of Directors upon the County Treasurer for the period beginning July 1, 1951, and ending June 30, 1952, the payment of which was authorized by the Dorchester County Delegation to the General Assembly, are hereby approved and confirmed.
Any contracts entered into, except as provided in this section, are hereby declared void and of no effect upon the County of Dorchester, Section 2.

That in case of a vacancy by death, resignation or otherwise in the office of any magistrate, constable or other officer of Dorchester County, the salary, expenses and other emoluments shall only be paid to a successor who has been recommended for appointment by the Senator and the member of the House of Representatives ftom Dorchester County.

The Treasurer of Dorchester County is hereby authorized and empowered to pledge as security for the payment of any sum or sums borrowed under the authorization contained in this Supply Act for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 1952, and ending June 30, 1953, for the operating expenses of the county for such period any part or all of the bonds or other securities held and owned by the county.
All bills presented to the County Board of Commissioners of said county shall be itemized.

The proceeds thereof to be used for the purchase of materials and the construction of and equipment for an office building to be erected by the said County Board of Directors on the courthouse grounds or on property owned by Dorchester County adjacent to the said courthouse grounds in the Town of St. George, Dorchester County, South Carolina, or for the purchase of materials and the renovating of and additions to and equipping the present courthouse of said county.

(b) The said County Board of Directors is hereby authorized in carrying out the purpose of this section to apply for, receive and accept any grants, gifts or loans from the Government of the United States of America or any of its agencies or from any other source znd any such funds so received shall be used along with the funds so borrowed in carrying out the purpose of this section.

During the year 1952, there shall be taxes levied in the various school districts for school purposes in amount of like millage as was levied during the year 1951, unless heretofore or hereinafter changed as provided by law.
All acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are hereby repealed. Approved the 4th day of April, 1952

975 An Act To Provide For The Levy Of Taxes For Ordinary County And School Purposes Of Edgefield County From July 1, 1952, Through June 30, 1953; To Provide For The Expenditure ThereOf; And To Otherwise Regulate The Affairs Of The County.

That a tax of sufficient number of mills less the estimated revenue to be received by Edgefield County from July 1, 1952, through June 30, 1953, to pay the appropriations hereinafter made, the amount of such millage to be determined by the county auditor, after consulation with the members of the Edgefield Legislative Delegation, is hereby levied upon all the taxable property of Edgefield County for county purposes for the year beginning July 1, 1952, and ending June 30, 1953, for the amounts and purposes hereinafter stated as follows, to wit: Maintenance of chaingang, bridges, roads and buildings $ 32,000.00 Clerk of Court 950.00 960.00 Clerical Help for Clerk of Court Sheriff 2,400.00 Provided, the sheriff or his deputies shall serve warrants for magistrate of the Third District.
