Clerical aid for Probate Judge 500.00 Clerk to Board of County Commissioners 960.00 Miscellaneous Accounts 3,000.00 Contingent Fund Farm Agent 75.00 GRAND TOTAL $ 730120 Section 2.

The board of county commissioners is hereby authorized to divide the expenditures of such appropriations in monthly payments as nearly as practicable, and borrow money, if necessary, in sufficient sums to meet the expenses of the year 19521953.

The jailor of the county shall be appointed by the sheriff and shall serve at the pleasure of the sheriff; and shall receive one dollar per day for dieting each prisoner, to be paid out of the fund for dieting of prisoners and jail, to be in full payment of fees and salary.
The court crier, jurors, jury boy and bailiffs shall receive four dollars per day for each days service in attendance upon court.
No telephone shall be maintained by the county except with the written approval of the county supervisor and at least one commissioner.

All purchases for gang, road, bridges, buildings and their maintenance, of any kind whatsoever, must be made by the supervisor personally, or on his written order; provided, that no item costing over one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be bought by the supervisor without the written consent of at least one of the county commissioners.

The fee that may be charged by the Clerk of Court for Edgefield County for the recording, filing, indexing or registering any mortgage or other instrument conveying an interest in, or creating a lien on crops growing or to be grown or personal property and made to any corporation organized under the Acts of Congress, known as the Farm Credit Act of 1933, if and as amended, a Regional Agricultural Credit Corporation, a Federal Intermediate Credit Bank, or any other corporation which rediscounts notes or other obligations with or procures loans from a Federal Intermediate Credit Bank, the Reconstruction Finance Corporation or the Government of the United States or any department, agency, instrumentality or office thereof, shall be seventyfive cents; and a copy or duplicate of such instrument shall be furnished to the recording officer.

The fee that may be charged by the clerk of court for search and a certificate of priority liens on crops for each loan shall be twentyfive cents; provided, that Edgefield County is specifically excepted from the provisions of Section 3638, Code of Laws of South Carolina, 1942.

That the fee for recording a deed to real estate when the number of words does not exceed one thousand shall be one dollar, and when the number of words exceeds one thousand it shall be at the rate of ten cents per hundred words.
The county board of education shall operate the schools in Edgefield County on what is commonly known as a county unit plan or system.

The county board of education of the county shall be, and it is hereby empowered to fix and regulate the salaries of all supervisors, superintendents, principals, teachers, janitors, bus drivers and any other person or persons employed directly or indirectly in connection with the school system of Edgefield County, and no person shall be employed or salary paid in any position aforesaid, or in any other capacity in connection with the school system of the county.
without the approval of the county board of education.

The county board of education shall have the power, and it is hereby authorized to consolidate, affiliate and abolish schools in the county when, in its judgment, economy or efficiency will result from such action.

The board shall have full power to outline and locate bus routes in the county, determine the schools to which pupils are to be transported for educational purposes and may refuse the transfer or transportation of pupils to schools in other counties if, in its judgment, economical and efficient education can be provided for the purpils in Edgefield County.

The superintendents of the high school districts are required to make an annual report on or before January 15th of each year to the county board of education setting forth the number of teachers employed in each school in their respective districts, and the salary paid each teacher, the average enrollment and the average attendance, the amount spent for incidentals, and they shall also submit their recommendations.at this time for the school year beginning July Ist.

The amounts provided for herein for the several purposes shall be expended for the purpose stated and none other, and any unexpended balance on hand at the expiration of the period herein provided for shall revert to the general funds of the county.

No county funds shall be expended for any purpose unless such expenditure is specifically authorized by the provisions of this act, or by the written authorization of the members of the Edgefield County Delegation.

In the event it should be determined by the proper authorities that the amount herein appropriated for any purpose is insufficient, then the supervisor is directed to notify the legislative delegation and the legislative delegation shall have the authority to transfer sufficient funds to take care of same, and the legislative delegation shall have the authority to transfer from the county surplus funds to any other fund, such sum or sums as in the opinion of the legislative delegation may be in the best interest of the county.
The allotment of office space in the courthouse to the various officers and departments shall be made by the supervisor who shall have complete charge of the courthouse.
The deputy tax collector shall assist in the collection of all delinquent taxes, shall furnish his own transportation, and shall serve warrants for the magistrate of the first district.
This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 29th day of February, 1952.

That so much of the amount hereinabove appropriated of the County Health Unit under Item 5 shall be expended as may be necessary to meet the requirements established under the State Appropriation Bill for Health Department Work.

This fund shall be expended under the following provisions: Provided, that the physician to be employed shall be a graduate of a regular medical college and skilled in hygienic and sanitary science, the physician shall be designated county health officer, and shall perform all such duties as may be imposed upon him by the sanitary laws of the state, and shall discharge all the duties of County Physician, and that a trained public nurse shall be employed who shall devote her whole time to public works in Fairfield County, and such other workers as may be found necessary and desirable to properly carry out a public health program; provided, however, that as far as possible, a medical inspection of all school children in Fairfield County shall be made by the physician in charge and that all trustees and principals, shall give every assistance in carrying out this program; provided, further, that this appropriation is contingent upon the full compliance of this section.

977 An Act To Authorize The Town Council Of Winnsboro, In Fairfield County, To Borrow Not Exceeding Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000.00), And To Provide For The Payment Thereof.

Winnsboro borrow for sewerage system.The Town Council of Winnsboro, in Fairfield County, is authorized to borrow not exceeding fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00), payable in fifteen years, at a rate of interest not exceeding three per cent, for the purpose of improving and extending the sewerage system of the Town of Winnsboro.
The loan shall be secured by notes executed by the mayor and council of the town.

Payment.In order to provide for the payment of the loan and interest thereon, there is hereby levied an annual tax upon all of the taxable property in the Town of Winnsboro, sufficient to retire the loan plus interest within a period of fifteen years.

The entire proceeds of this tax levy shall be paid annually to the party from whom the money is borrowed, and shall be applied on the principal and interest of the notes given to secure the loan, until the debt with interest is paid in full, at which time the tax shall no longer be levied.
The Town Council of Winnsboro shall levy, and the town treasurer shall collect the tax so levied.

Such officers of the County of Florence as are charged with the expenditure or disbursement of the above appropriations shall state upon each warrant drawn upon the county treasurer the item in the Appropriation Act on account of which the warrant shall have been drawn and such disbursing officer shall not draw their warrant upon the county treasurer in any amoiints singly or in the aggregate for more than has been appropriated for the specific purpose for which the warrant is drawn, except upon the written consent of all of the legislative delegation, and no warrant paid by the county treasurer shall be allowed as a credit to him in his settlement unless it conforms with the above requirements ; Provided, further, the Governing Board of Florence County is hereby authorized to borrow the funds hereinabove appropriated and pledge therefor the taxes to be collected for 1952; Provided, further, that upon any matter which the Governing Board of Florence County is required to act in connection with the countys business and affairs a majority of said board shall be sufficient.

The Governing Board shall award this loan to the lowest bona fide bidder, advertising for open bids in one or more newspapers published in Florence County at least ten days prior ta awarding bids, and at the same time notify each bank in Florence County in writing the terms and conditions under which the bids are received.

The proceeds of this loan shall be deposited with the successful bidder; Provided, the successful bidder is an incorporated bank within the County of Florence, South Carolina; Provided, further, that before depositing any funds of the county in any bank or banks, such bank or banks shall secure the safe deposit of said funds by depositing with the county treasurer a trust receipt certifying that securities to the amount of such deposit or deposits have been duly set aside in some bank or trust company to be approved by the county board and are being held in trust for the County of Florence to secure the said deposit; Provided, further, that the securities shall be bonds or obligations issued by the United States of America, the State of South Carolina, or some political or governmental subdivision thereof, either or both, or Federal Land Bank, or Joint Stock Land Banks, or Home Owners Loan Bonds; provided, further, that the deposit so made and secured shall remain with the bank or banks, receiving it until used for the purpose for which it was borrowed, and all other funds of the county not already pledged shall be deposited with such successful bidder or bidders.

All road machinery, plows, equipment, etc., to be purchased by the County of Florence from the funds herein appropriated shall be bought only upon competitive sealed bids, after two weeks advertisement for such bids in some newspaper best circulated to give notice to the trade, which advertisement shall designate the time and place at which the bids will be open, and the said bids shall be publicly opened at the time and place designated in the advertisement.
No purchase shall be made for Florence County of any kind, whatsoever, from any members of the Governing Board, or any relative of any member of the Governing Board within the sixth degree.

The Clerk of Court for Florence County shall record all tax titles made to the Forfeited Land Commission for Florence County from the delinquent tax collector and the auditor of the county shall record the transfer thereof without charge in part consideration of the compensation now received by these officers.

979 An Act To Provide For The Levy Of A Tax For School Purposes In Florence County For The Year 19521953, For The Expenditure Thereof, For Borrowing Money For School Purposes; To Require School Trustees To Prepare Budgets Of School Expenses And To Prohibit Expenditures In Excess Of Budgets.

Appropriation for educational purposes, Florence County.The sum of thirtyfour thousand six hundred ninety dollars ($34,690.00) is hereby appropriated for educational purposes for the County of Florence for the fiscal year 19521953, and a tax of two mills to raise that sum is hereby levied upon all taxable property of Florence County which sum shall be expended for the following purposes: Item I: Free Textbooks $13,500.00 Item II: Circulating Library 3,300.00 500.00 Item III: Supplies Item IV: County Board Expense 2,000.00 8,390.00 Item V: Superintendents Office Item VI: Hot Lunch Program 7,000.00 TOTAL $34,690.00 Section 2.

Borrow.lIn order to carry out the purpose of this act and for the operation of schools in Florence County, the board of education for the county is authorized to borrow such sum of money as may be necessary, the amount not to exceed fifty per cent of the taxes pledged for the payment thereof, and shall have the power to pledge any part or all of the school taxes levied in Florence County as security therefor.

In the event it becomes necessary to borrow money for these purposes, the county board shall award the loan or loans to be made therefor to the lowest bona fide bidder, after first advertising for bids by notice published in one or more newspapers having circulation in Florence County for at least ten days prior to awarding any such bids, and after giving written notice to all banks in Florence County of the terms and conditions under which bids shall be received.

Budgets.The board of trustees of the various school districts in Florence County shall, on or before the first day of June each year thereafter, prepare a budget showing in detail the items of proposed expenditures for the schools in their respective districts for the next ensuing year and file it with the board of education for the county for its examination and approval.
Additional.This act is intended to be in addition to, and not in conflict with, any of the provisions of the general supply act of Florence County for the ensuing year.

980 An Act To Declare That The ThreeYear Limitation In Section 11, Act 409 Of The Acts And Joint Resolutions Of The General Assembly, 1951, And The Provision Contained In The Act Repealing Prior Laws, Should Not Affect The Right Of The City Council Of Florence To Issue Certain Bonds Of The City, For The Purposes Of Extending And Improving The Waterworks System And The Sewerage System Of The City, And For The Purpose Of Constructing Storm Drains Designed To Improve The System Of Draining Streets In The City, Voted At A Special Election Held In The City Of Florence On November 22, 1949, And To Authorize The City Council Of Florence To Issue Such Bonds At Any Time On Or Before July 31, 1954, Provided That The Proceedings Taken By City Council Subsequent To July 31, 1951, Shall Conform To Those Prescribed By Act 409 Of 1951.

Whereas, heretofore, in pursuance of and in conformity with the provisions of Section 7327, et seq., Volume 4, Code of Laws of South Carolina for 1942, and a petition signed by a majority of the freeholders of the city, as shown by its tax books, a special election was held in the City of Florence on the twentysecond day of November, 1949, to determine the questions of whether: 1.

The city council of said city should be empowered to issue, either as a single issue or from time to time as several separate issues, not exceeding two million six hundred twentythree thousand dollars ($2,623,000.00) of general obligation bonds of the City of Florence, whose proceeds shall be expended for extensions and improvements to the Waterworks System and the Sewerage System of the City of Florence?

The city council of said city should be empowered to issue, either as a single issue or from time to time as several separate issues, not exceeding seven hundred twentytwo thousand dollars ($722,000.00) of general obligation bonds of the City of Florence, whose proceeds shall be expended for the construction of storm drains designed to improve the present system of draining streets in the City of Florence?

The city council of said city should be empowered to issue, either as a single issue or from time to time as several separate issues, not exceeding one hundred fiftyfive thousand dollars ($155,000.00) of general obligation bonds of the City of Florence, whose proceeds shall be expended for improvements and equipment for the Fire Department of the City of Florence?
which election resulted favorably upon each of the questions submitted ; and, Whereas, in pursuance of the authority thus conferred upon the City Council of Florence, and Act No.
1213 of the Acts and Joint Resolutions of the General Assembly, 1950, 46th Statutes at Large, page 3057, the City Council of Florence has issued and sold: 1.
$155,000.00 City of Florence Fire Protection Bonds, dated February 1, 1950, 2.
$1,000,000.00 City of Florence Waterworks and Sewerage Extension Bonds, dated February 1, 1950, and 3.

$1,000,000.00 City of Florence Waterworks and Sewerage Extension Bonds, Series B, dated December 1, 1950; and, Whereas, due to the nature and extent of the program envisaged by the expenditures thus authorized, it was recommended to the city that the bonds be sold over a period of time, corresponding as nearly as possible to the period of construction, so that there now remains unissued and unsold by the City of Florence: 1.
$623,000.00 of bonds, whose proceeds must be expended for improvements and extensions to the Waterworks System and the Sewerage System of the City of Florence, and, 2.

$722,000.00 of bonds, whose proceeds must be expended for the construction of storm drains, designed to improve the present system of draining streets in the City of Florence; and, Whereas, subsequent to the aforesaid election and act, viz., on July 31, 1951, Section 7327, et seq., was repealed by the Municipal Bond Act of South Carolina (Act No.

409 of the Acts and Joint Resolutions of the General Assembly of the State of South Carolina, 1951, the statute recodifying and redefining the procedure by which municipal corporations in this state might issue general obligation bonds), in which act a time limit was imposed for the isstiance of bonds authorized by any special election; and, Whereas, by reason of the repealing clause and the threeyear limitation in the Municipal Bond Act, question has arisen as to whether the authorization above recited is still available to the City of Florence, and whether it must be exercised within three years following the date of the special election; and, Whereas, it was the intention of the General Assembly, in enacting said Act 409 of 1951 that it merely affect proceedings taken sub, sequent to its effective date, but that it should in no way affect the validity of or right to issue bonds duly voted prior to the effective date of the act, nor that the time limit therein imposed should be applicable to bonds voted prior to such enactment, it merely being the intent that further proceedings should conform to the act.

Statements in preamble true and express correct legislative intent as to Municipal Bond ActFlorence may issue certain waterworks, sewerage and drainage bonds.The General Assembly finds that the matters set forth in the preambles to this act are in all respects true and correct and express the correct legislative intent in the enactment of Act 409 of 1951; and that such act should not be a bar to the issuance by the City Council of Florence of the: 1.

$623,000.00 of bonds, whose proceeds must be expended for improvements and extensions to the Waterworks System and the Sewerage System of the City of Florence, and, ~ 29 $722,000.00 of bonds, whose proceeds must be expended for the construction of storm drains, designed to improve the present system of draining streets in the City of Florence, and that such bonds may be issued by the city council at such time or times as the City Council of Florence shall determine, provided always that the bonds be issued not later than three years from the effective date of Act 409 of 1951, viz., on or before July 31, 1954.
Time effective.This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 15th day of February, 1952.

Subitems of subdivisions under sections, Item 1 and Item 2 of this act may be diverted to any other subdivision under the same item, where such action is found to meet the deficiency in such subitem or subdivisions, such diversions to be made by the county board of commissioners, and upon and after the approval of the Greenville County Legislative Delegation at a duly called meeting; Provided, the total appropriation of Item 1 be not thereby exceeded; Provided, further, that like diversion in other items under Section 2 may be likewise made where no salary or fixed charge is thereby affected.
No per diem shall be allowed out of Items 9 and 10 to any salaried officer of Greenville County.

Subitem B under Item 2, entitled Contingent Fund of fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000.00) hereinabove referred to, shall be expended in the discretion of, and under the direction of the Greenville County Delegation, upon claims, demands and petitions previously approved by the county board of commissioners and for such purposes as may be prescribed by the delegation at regular called meetings duly assembled; Provided, that notices of any meetings shall state the matters to be considered, and any question or proposal not stated in the notice of a called meeting shall not be passed upon at such meeting unless as many as six members present vote in favor of considering the same; Provided, that no part of said funds shall be expended for the purpose of increasing the salary of any.

officer or employee of Greenville County ; Provided, further, that any special attorneys fees and the indebtedness on Block Book Contracts shall be charged against the contingent fund provided the delegation so directs.

The exact amount to be paid by this act appropriated as salary for each of said officers is a sufficient sum to make a total salary of four thousand six hundred sixty dollars ($4,660.00) when added to the amount paid by the state.

. Members of the Board of Assessors for Greenville County except the members of the Special Board of Assessors for the City of Greenville shall be paid seven dollars and fifty cents per day for their services, and the members of the Special Board for the City of Greenville shall be paid ten dollars per day for their services.
The Special Board for the City of Greenville may employ a clerk, who shall receive as compensation for his or her services the sum of five dollars per day for not exceeding ninety days.
Provided, that no one shall be employed for the purpose without the prior approval and authorization of the chairman of the board.

The County Board of Commissioners of Greenville County is hereby authorized to reduce the annual tax levy of any subdistrict of Greater Greenville Sewer District, whenever it shall appear to the commission that the levy of any such subdistrict is excessive and higher than necessary to meet the debt service requirements and ope rating expenses of such subdistricts.

The Supervisor of Greenville County is hereby authorized and permitted to use county road machinery for the purpose of scraping and repairing private entrances and driveways leading into public highways in this county, when, in his opinion, such scraping or repairing is for the protection of the existing roads and highways and for the proper drainage thereof.

The Supervisor of Greenville County is also, hereby authorized and permitted to use county labor, machinery and equipment to prepare and surface the roads or streets of any mill or industrial village within Greenville County, whenever the management of any such mill or industry furnishes the materials for surfacing said streets.

. The County Board of Commissioners of Greenville County, with the approval of the Greenville County Legislative Delegation is hereby authorized to acquire from the United States of America, or any agency, department, authority, corporation or commission thereof, by purchase, lease, loan, gift or otherwise, such equipment, machinery, supplies, materials, or property, real or personal both as the county board of commissioners in its discretion shall deem necessary or beneficial to Greenville County or to any of its political subdivisions and to execute and deliver for and on behalf of the county, or any of its political subdivisions, any contract, lease, or other instruments as may be necessary to consummate any transaction.

. The County Board of Commissioners of Greenville County, subject to the written approval of the Supervisor of Greenville County, is hereby authorized to contract with the South Carolina Highway Department for the construction by the county of any road or roads or street or streets within the county, and to pay all cost of construction thereof out of the general fund of Greenville County pending the payment from the Highway Department for such construction.

Any excess funds which may be received from the Highway Department over and above construction costs may be used by the Supervisor of Greenville County in improving and constructing roads within the county.

. The County Board of Commissioners of Greenville County is hereby authorized to consolidate all funds appropriated for use by the Supervisor of Greenville County during the fiscal year 19511952 for payment of bills accruing on or before June 30, 1952.

. No department head of Greenville County shall make any purchase, or contract to purchase, any materials, supplies, equipment or services in excess of one hundred dollars ($100.00) without a purchase order previously approved by the county board of commissioners, the board being hereby authorized and directed to prescribe such forms and bookkeeping methods, and to promulgate such rules as will carry out the purposes of this provision.
The county board shall not approve any purchase order which will involve an obligation over and above the appropriation provided for that purpose.

The county board of commissioners is authorized and directed to allow the Associate Justice of the Supreme Court residing in the City of Greenville the use, without charge, of necessary office space in the courthouse building and any allowance made by the state therefor maybe used by him as supplemental office expenses.

Should any part or section of this act be invalidated by court decision on the ground of illegality or unconstitutionality such decision shall render invalid or inoperative only such portion or portions of this act as may be specifically so invalidated, the remainder to continue in full force and effect.
All expenditures heretofore authorized by the Greenville County Legislative Delegation and not heretofore validated, are hereby ratified and validated.

Whereas, Greenville County holds certain notes which were heretofore executed to it by certain school districts within Greenville County evidencing loans made to such districts, and Hhereas, the said districts have been consolidated and now comprise a part of Greenville County School District No.

Now therefore, The Treasurer of Greenville County is hereby authorized and directed to cancel the said notes which are hereby declared to be no obligation of the said Greenville County School District No.

Whereas, there will be an estimated surplus of three hundred and twenty thousand dollars ($320,000.00) in the Greenville CountyWide General Fund Debt Service as of June 30, 1952, and Hhercas, this said sum will be sufficient to pay the countywide bonds maturing during the fiscal year 19521953, with an estimated surplus as of June 30, 1953 of seventyfive thousand dollars ($75,000.00).

Now, therefore, The Greenville County Auditor is hereby directed to suspend the levy for countywide bonds for the fiscal year 19521953 and is hereby directed to make no levy for said purpose for said fiscal year.
No department, agency or officer of Greenville County shall receive additional pay or any overtime pay during the period for which the apppropriations are made in this act.

984 An Act To Provide For The Purchase Of A Site And For The Construction Of A Childrens Home For Delinquent And Misplaced Children In Greenville County And To Appropriate Funds Therefor.

Appropriation for site for childrens home, Greenville County.The Greenville County Board of Commissioners is hereby authorized, empowered and directed to purchase from Agnes and Tommy Thompson for the sum of six thousand two hundred and fifty dollars ($6,250.00) a certain tract of land, situate on the Old Easley Bridge Road, about five and onehalf miles from the Greenville County Courthouse and containing fiftythree acres, more or less, to be used as site for the location of a childrens home for delinquent and misplaced children, and there is hereby appropriated the sum of six thousand two hundred and fifty dellars ($6,250.00) for said purpose.

Construct and equip home for childrenThe .Advisory Board to the Childrens Court of Greenville County is authorized to construct a childrens home and equip the home and in this connection may employ an architect or architects and to let contracts for the construction and equipping of said home on competitive bids with the right to reject any and all bids in the event that it is found to be impracticable to Ict contract on the basis of competitive bids for any special services for materials it shall not be necessary to let such contracts for competitive bids.
The advisory board is empowered to do all things ordinarily incident and necessary to the performance of the duties herein imposed upon it.

Appropriation for construction and equipment.There is hereby appropriated the sum of seventy thousand dollars ($70,000.00), which with any other funds in the hands of the board and applicable thereto, or so much thereof as may be necessary, shall be used for the purposes mentioned in Section 2 of this act.

Disposition of present childrens home.When the childrens home, herein provided for, shall have been constructed and the home now used for the purpose shall have been vacated, the present childrens home and the land connected therewith shall become part of the Greenville County Farmers Wholesale Market and shall be subject to the management and control of the Greenville County Farmers Wholesale Market Commission.
Time effective.This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 27th day of March, 1952.
985 An Act To Authorize The Chairman Of The Greenville County Board Of Commissioners And The Greenville County Supervisor To Lease Certain Property Of The County For The Purpose Of A Childrens Home.

Greenville County may lease property for County Home.The Chairman of the Greenville County Board and the Greenville County Supervisor are authorized and directed to enter into a lease agreement with Childrens Center of Greenville, an eleemosynary corporation, covering ten acres, more or less, the property of the County of Greenville, situate, lying and being on the Southeast side of Rutherford Road (Old U. S. Highway No.
29) being on the opposite side of said road from Greenville County Home.

The terms of the lease shall be for fifty years at one dollar per year; provided, however, that the lease shall be terminated automatically if and when the property is no longer used for the purposes of a county home and uses pertinent thereto.
Provided, however, that the County of Greenville shall retain the right to continue the use of that portion of the ten acres now being used for a paupers burial ground.
. Repeal.aAll acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are hereby repealed .
Time effective This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 22nd day of March, 1952.
986 An Act To Amend Section 3 Of Act No.

559, Acts And Joint Resolutions Of South Carolina, 1951, Relating To The MauldinSimpsonvilleFountain Inn Water District, So As To Provide For The Appointment Of Commissioners Of The District And To Name Two Members Of The Commission In Place Of Two Who Have Resigned.
Vacancies on MauldinSimpsonvilleFountain Inn Water District Commission filledMr.

J. M. Griffin of Mauldin and Mr. G. R. Richardson of Simpsonville, having resigned as members of the MauldinSimpsonvilleFountain Inn Water District Commission, their respective offices are hereby declared vacant and Mr. T. C. Alexander of Mauldin, S. C., and Mr. George Webb of Simpsonville, S. C., are hereby named to fill the respective vacancies for the terms hereinafter designated.
Act 559 of 1951 amendedboard of commissionersappointmentterms.Section 3 of Act No.
559 of the Acts and Joint Resolutions of South Carolina, 1951, is amended by striking out all of same and inserting in lieu thereof the following to be Section 3: section 3.
The governing authority of the district shall be vested in a commission to be composed of three resident electors of the district, who shall serve without compensation.

One shall be a resident of that portion of the district lying inside the corporate limits of the Town of Simpsonville; one shall be a resident of that portion of district lying inside the corporate limits of the Town of Fountain Inn; and one shall be a resident of that portion of the district lying outside the two named incorporated towns.

Immediately upon the passage and approval of this act the Governor shall commission Mr. George Webb of Simpsonville, S. C., for a term of two years, Mr. Claude A. Parsons of Fountain Inn, S. C., for a term of four years, and Mr. T. C. Alexander of Mauldin, S. C., for a term of six years, the successors of each appointee herein shall serve for a term of six years.
The successors to the appointees herein shall be commissioned by the Governor upon the recommendation of a majority of the Greenville County Legislative Delegation.

The board, as constituted, shall act under the stvle and name of The Board of Commissioners of the MauldinSimpsonvilleFountain Inn Water District. Section 3. Repeal.aAll acts or parts of acts inconsistent herewith are hereby repealed.
Time effectiveThis act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 13th day of February, 1952.

988 An Act To Empower The Committee Of Parker Water And Sewer Subdistrict Of Greater Greenville Sewer District, In Greenville County, To Borrow Not Exceeding Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000.00), To Prescribe The Terms And Conditions Under Which Such Borrowing May Be Effected, And To Make Provision For The Payment Of All Loans Made Pursuant To This Act.

Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict Committee of Greater Greenville Sewer District borrow to extend water and sewerage facilitiesIn order to enable it to obtain funds to defray the cost of extending water and sewer facilities in Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of Greater Greenville Sewer District, as such Subdistrict is now or may hereafter be constituted, the Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict Committee of Greater Greenville Sewer District, in Greenville County, is empowered to borrow not exceeding Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000.00).
Issue bonds.The loans hereby authorized shall be evidenced by bonds of said Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of Greater Greenville Sewer District.

Such bonds may be issued as one single issue or, from time to time, as several separate issues ; they shall bear such date or dates as the Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict Committee shall determine, and the bonds of any issue shall mature in such equal or unequal annual installments as may be determined by the Committee, except that the last maturing bonds of any issue shall mature not later than thirty years from their date.
They shall be made payable at such place or places as the Committee shall prescribe, and they shall bear interest at such rate or rates, payable in such manner, as the Committee may determine.

The bonds may be issued with the privilege to the holder of having them registered as to principal on the books of the Treasurer of Greenville County, and the principal thus made payable to the registered holder (unless the last registered transfer shall have been to bearer) upon such conditions as the Committee may prescribe.

Any bond issued pursuant to the provisions of this act may be made subject to redemption prior to its stated maturity on such terms and conditions, and with such redemption premium as the Committee shall prescribe.

Sale of bonds.All bonds issued pursuant to this act shall be sold at not less than par and accrued interest to the date of their respective deliveries, at public sale, and at least ten days prior to any sale, notice, announcing the intention to receive bids for the sale of any bonds authorized by this act, shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the State of South Carolina.

In offering the bonds for sale, the Committee may reserve the right to reject any and all bids, and if all bids are rejected, the Committee shall at least ten days prior to any reoffering for sale, give notice, announcing its intention to receive bids for the sale of any bonds authorized by this act, and shall publish such notice in a newspaper having general circulation in South Carolina, with privilege to reject any and all bids.

Exempt from taxes.The bonds and thc interest to tie: come due thereon shall be exempt from all state, county, municipal, school district, and all other taxes or assessments, direct or indirect, general or special, whether imposed for the purpose of general revenue or otherwise.

Execution All bonds issued pursuant to this act shall be executed in the name of Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of Greater Greenville Sewer District by the Chairman of Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict Committee and the Treasurer of Greenville County, under the Seal of the Committee.
The coupons attached to the bonds may be authenticated by the facsimile signatures of the Chairman and the Treasurer of Greenville County, who are in office on the date of such bonds.
The delivery of any bonds so executed and authenticated shall be valid notwithstanding any changes in officers or seal occurring after such execution or such authentication.

Payment.For the payment of the bonds, both principal and interest, as the same respectively mature, the full faith, credit and resources of Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of Greater Greenville Sewer District is pledged, and there shall be levied by the Auditor and collected by the Treasurer of Greenville County, an ad valorem tax upon all taxable property in the Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of Greater Greenville Sewer District, without limitation as to rate or amount, sufficient to pay the interest on the bonds and the bonds as they respectively mature.

The taxes, when so levied and collected, shall be held by the Treasurer of Greenville County, separate and distinct from all other funds and used solely for the purposes for which levied and collected under the terms of this act.

Deposit and expenditure of proceeds.The proceeds derived from the sale of bonds issued pursuant to this act shall be deposited with the Treasurer of Greenville County in a separate and special fund, and shall be expended upon the warrants or orders of the Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict Committee for the purpose of extending water and sewer facilities in the subdistrict and the payment of any costs and expenses incident thereto, including the cost of issuing the bonds, except that any premium or accrued interest received from the sale of such bonds shall be used to pay the interest and principal installments first becoming due.
The purchasers of any bonds, or any subsequent holder, shall in no wise be responsible for the proper application of the proceeds.

Greater Greenville Sewer District Commission must approve.Provided always that, the other provisions of this act notwithstanding, no bonds shall be issued pursuant to this act without the approval in writing of the Greater Greenville Sewer District Commission.
Time effective This act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 15th day of April, 1952.

989 An Act To Create And Incorporate A Water District Within Greenville County To Be Known As Marietta Water District; To Provide For Its Government And Control; To Determine And Fix The Powers And Duties Of Its Governing Officials; To Provide For The Issuance Of Bonds By The District In An Amount Not To Exceed SeventyFive Thousand Dollars ($75,000.00) For The Purpose Of Securing Funds With Which To Purchase, Install, And Maintain A Water System In The District To Provide Water For The Residents Thereof; And To Authorize The Levy Of A Tax On All Taxable Property Within The District For The Payment Of Principal And Interest Of The Bonds.

Marietta Water District, Greenville County.A water district, to be known and designated as Marietta Water District. is hereby created and established a body corporate and politic to cover, include and be comprised of the territory and area hereinafter described, and lying in Greenville County, South Carolina.

Commissiontermselection.The governing authority of the district shall be vested in a commission to be composed of three resident electors of the district, who shall serve without compensation.
Their regular terms of office shall be for six years and until their successors have been elected and qualify.

The initial terms of office shall be for six, four and two years and the following residents of the district are named as commissioners for the intial term: Joe A. Phillips, who is appointed for a term of six years; James Cleveland, for a term of four years; and Terry F. Guest, for a term of two years.
There shall be an election in the district every two years to choose a successor to the commissioner whose term expires in such year.
Upon appointment, the commissioners shall qualify by taking the usual oath of office and shall organize by electing one of their number as chairman and another as secretary.
After each election and the qualifying of the newlyelected commissioner, the board of commissioners shall select a new chairman and a new secretary.
Any chairman or secretary may succeed himself.
The elections herein provided for shall be conducted under the laws regulating elections in South Carolina.
The board as constituted shall act under the style and name of the Board of Commissioners of Marietta Water District.

Duties and powers of commission.The district, through its board of commissioners, shall have and exercise powers and duties as follows: buy, accept as gifts, construct, establish, enlarge, maintain, conduct and operate a water system or plant, or water systems or plants to provide and furnish an adequate supply of water, for all purposes, for the district and the residents thereof, it being entirely within the discretion of the board of commissioners to determine the manner in which it shall furnish and provide the water, whether by establishing and equipping a water system within the district, or to do so in conjunction with any other person, corporation or corporate body empowered to act, or to enter into a contract or contracts for such purpose by having water, or facilities for providing water, furnished it from any other source, and paying therefor in accordance with the terms of such contract, or by any other means advisable to the board of commissioners.

The district, through its board of commissioners, shall have and exercise the power and authority to acquire, purchase, lease and sell such real estate, easements, rightsofway, and personal or mixed property as may be deemed necessary to enable the district to carry out and perform the duty of providing an adequate water supply for the district and its residents ; and the district, through its board of commissioners, shall have and exercise the power and authority to make any and all contracts, to employ such engineers, office and clerical help as may be deemed necessary, to fix the compensation of such employees, to acquire all necessary equipment and facilities and do all such other things that it may deem necessary to provide and furnish an ample supply of water for the district and its residents.

The district, by and through its board of commissioners, shall have power and authority, and it shall be its duty, to sell water from its plant or system to the residents of the district, or to those net residents thereof if there remains a surplus after having provided the requirements of those who are residents of the district, in conformity with a rate schedule to be prescribed by it, and to make and enforce such reasonable rules and regulations as it may deem proper to secure itself against nonpayment of its charges therefor.

The district, by and through its board of commissioners, is authorized and empowered in its discretion, to purchase any water system or plant, or any part thereof, already existing, or being operated within the district, on such terms and at such price as the board of commissioners may deem proper, having in mind at all times the value thereof to the districts system or plant as a whole; and the district.
by or through its board of commissioners, shall have the pewer of condemnation for the purposes herein conferred upon it.

Methods use raise funds.The district shall have the power to raise funds necessary for the discharge of the powers vested in it, including the payment of principal and interest of all bonds, if and when any such bonds may be issued, in either of the following ways, or by a combination thereof, in the discretion of its board of commissioners: (a) By selling water to be supplied by the district; and (b) By levying a tax upon all the taxable property of the district.

Issue bonds for water system if election thereon favorable.The district, by and through its board of commissioners, in order to enable it to carry out the purposes of its creation and organization, which is to provide an ample supply of water for its residents, is hereby authorized and empowered to issue bonds of the district in the sum of not more than seventyfive thousand dollars ($75,000.00), the proceeds from which shall be used by the district in establishing, acquiring, extending, enlarging and maintaining water plants or water systems in the district.
The bonds may be issued as a single issue or from time to time as several separate issues.

The bonds shall be issued as serial bonds, maturing in such equal or unequal amounts as the board of commissioners shall determine, except that the maturity schedule of any series or issue of bonds, issued pursuant to this act, shall be arranged so that the last annual instalment shall fall due not later than twentyfive years from the date such series or issue of bonds shall bear.
Any bond issued pursuant to this act may, at the discretion of the board of commissioners, contain a provision permitting its redemption prior to its stated maturity at premium figures.
Such issue or series of bonds shall bear such date or dates, and such rate or rates of interest as the board of commissioners may determine.
Each issue or series of bonds shall be in such denomination or denominations, and shall be payable at such place or places as said board of commissioners may by resolution determine.

The said bonds may be issued with the privilege to the holder of having them registered as to principal on the books of the Treasurer of Greenville County and the principal thus made payable to the registered holder (unless the last registered transfer shall have been to bearer) upon such conditions as said board of commissioners may prescribe.

The bonds shall be signed by the chairman and secretary of the board of commissioners of the district, and the seal of the Marietta Water District shall be affixed to or impressed upon the bonds, but the coupons on said bonds need not be authenticated other than by the facsimile signatures of the officials lithographed or engraved thereon.
The bonds shall be issued and sold from time to time, and in such amounts as the board of commissioners of the district shall determine.
The sales shall be made to the highest bidder for cash after such advertisement as the board may deem proper, but the board shall have the right to reject any and all bids in its discretion.

Payment of bondsfurther commission covenants.For the payment of said bonds and interest thereon, as the same mature, the full faith, credit and resources of the district are hereby irrevocably pledged, and the Auditor and Treasurer of Greenville County, respectivly, are hereby authorized and directed to levy and collect annually a tax, upon all taxable property within the district, sufficient to pay said bonds and interest as they respectively mature, and to create such sinking fund as may be necessary for the redemption of the bonds and interest at respective maturities.
The bonds shall be additionally secured by a pledge of the net revenues which the district may derive from the operation of its water plants or systems.

Such net revenues shall be delivered to the Treasurer of Greenville County, and he shall set them apart in a special fund and apply them solely to the payment of the principal and interest of the bonds authorized by this act, so long as any principal or interest of the bonds remain outstanding.

The annual ad valorem tax herein directed to be levied may be reduced in each year by the amount of net revenues as aforesaid, actually in the hands of the Treasurer of Greenville County at the time the tax for such year is required to be levied, exclusive of cushion or reserve fund, and the tax may be entirely suspended for any year in case such moneys on hand, applicable as aforesaid, are sufficient to pay both principal and interest then due or falling due in such year and remaining unpaid.

The commission shall be empowered to make such covenants as it deems desirable with respect to the operation and maintenance of its water plants or systems and of the use of the revenues for such purposes; it may covenant to establish a cushion or reserve fund and to set aside moneys to establish such a fund to insure the punctual payment of the principal and interest of the bonds authorized hereby; and it may provide for the establishment of funds to care for contingencies and for depreciation.

The pledge of the net revenues herein required need not, in the discretion of the commission, be exclusive, and the commission may reserve the right to issue further bonds additionally secured by such pledge, on a parity with the bonds authorized by this act, under such conditions as the commission shall prescribe.

Use of bond proceeds.The proceeds of the sale of the bonds as authorized herein shall be kept in a separate fund and shall be paid out, or used for no other purposes than those specified herein, and then only upon the orders, warrants or checks of the board of commissioners of the district.

Use of surplus income.Any income derived by or coming to the credit of the district from any source in excess of the amount necessary for the maintenance of the water plants or systems in the district shall be applied by the board of commissioners of the district, first to the payment of interest on the bonds as it becomes due, and next to the sinking fund for the retirement of bonds as they mature.

Election on issuance of bonds.Before any such bonds may be issued, a special election shall be held on a date to be fixed by the board of commissioners of the district at which time there shall be submitted to the qualified electors in the district the question of issuing bonds of the district for the purposes hereinbefore specified.

The election shall be conducted by the board of commissioners of the district, who shall give notice thereof by publication once each week for three successive weeks prior thereto in one or more newspapers with general circulation in the district stating the question to be submitted at the election and specifying the amount in dollars of the bonds proposed to be issued.

The question submitted shall be substantially as follows: Shall the Marietta Water District issue bonds in a sum not exceeding seventyfive thousand dollars ($75,000.00), the proceeds of which shall be used to establish a water system in the district?

YES No The ballot shall contain suitable instructions, advising the voter that if he favors the issuance of bonds, he shall erase or strike through the word NO and that if he is opposed to the issuance of bonds, he shall erase or strike through the word YES. The managers of the election at each precinct shall count the ballots and forthwith return the result of the election, together with the original ballots and tally sheets, to the Board of Commissioners of the Marietta Water District, who shall declare the result of the election.

If the board determines that a majority of the voters voting in the election voted in favor of the issuance of the bonds, the bonds or any part thereof may be issued, as herein provided, in one or more series and from time to time as the board may determine best, but if the board determines that a majority of the ballots cast in the election be against the issuance of the bonds, then no bonds shall be issued under the provisions of this act.
Time effectiveThis act shall take effect upon its approval by the Governor. Approved the 6th day of March, 1952.

9890 An Act To Validate The Proceedings And The Election Had To Annex Certain Adjacent Territory To Both Greater Greenville Sewer District And To Parker Water And Sewer Subdistrict Of The Greater Greenville Sewer District, And To Declare That Such Territory Constitutes A Part Of Both Of The Greater Greenville Sewer District And Of The Parker Water And Sewer Subdistrict Of The Greater Greenville Sewer District.

Extension of Greater Greenville Sewer District and Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of such district ratified.All proceedings heretofore had, including an election held on the 27th day of November, 1951, which resulted favorably on the question of the annexation thereby posed, to extend both Greater Greenville Sewer District and Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of the Greater Greenville Sewer District by annexing thereto certain adjacent territory to the Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of the Greater Greenville Sewer District, more fully set forth and delineated on a plat thereof filed in the Office of the Register of Mesne Conveyances for Greenville County on the 11th day of February, 1952, in Plat Book BB, pages 4 and 5, and also on file in the office of the Greater Greenville Sewer District Commission, are approved, ratified, validated, and confirmed, and said territory shall henceforth constitute a part of both Greater Greenville Sewer District and of Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of the Greater Greenville Sewer District.

Legislative findingThe General Assembly independently finds that the populous condition of the area herein declared annexed as aforesaid warrants and requires that there be made available to such territory such services and facilities as are afforded by the Greater Greenville Sewer District and the Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of the Greater Greenville Sewer District, and, therefore, incorporates the annexed area into the Greater Greenville Sewer District and into the Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of the Greater Greenville Sewer District, respectively, upon the terms and conditions heretofore fixed by the Committee of the Parker Water and Sewer Subdistrict of Greater Greenville Sewer District, and by the Greater Greenville Sewer District Commission.
